section.22: Oaths and Vows (Kitab Al-Aiman Wa Al-Nudhur)

hadiths.text: Sa'id ibn al-Musayyab said:There were two brothers among the Ansar who shared an inheritance. When one of them asked the other for the portion due to him, he replied: If you ask me again for the portion due to you, all my property will be devoted to the decoration of the Ka'bah. Umar said to him: The Ka'bah does not need your property. Make atonement for your oath and speak to your brother. I heard the Messenger of Allah (ï·º) say: An oath or vow to disobey the Lord, or to break ties of relationship or about something over which one has no control is not binding on you
